newsitem.title: UK: Barclays Imry sells assets to Rodamco.
newsitem.headline: Barclays Imry sells assets to Rodamco.

text.p: Barclays Plc said on Wednesday that Imry Holdings Ltd, which the UK bank controls, is selling various properties to Dutch fund management group Rodamco for 249 million stg.
Barclays said the proceeds of the sale would be used to repay third party debt of 114 million stg and to repay Barclays debt of 91 million.
It took control of Imry in 1992 after funding a 314 million stg buyout of the property group.
Barclays said Imry owns a shopping centre in Leicester plus the operating company of the shopping centre. It is also selling fourteen other properties.
The bank expects the sale will result in the release of some 25 million stg of provision in the first half of this year, which was made for Imry.
